ABNORMAL.Defintion: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad

ACCOMPLICES.Defintion: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong

ASSOCIATES.Defintion: people who are closely connected to another person as a companion, friend, or business partner

CAIPIRINHAS.Defintion: a Brazilian alcoholic drink made with Brazilian rum, lime juice, sugar, and ice

CARRIAGE.Defintion: any of the separate parts of a train in which the passengers sit

CARRIAGES.Defintion: any of the separate parts of a train in which the passengers sit

CASH.Defintion: money in the form of notes and coins, rather than cheques or credit cards

CIRCULATION.Defintion: the process in which something such as information, money, or goods passes from one person to another

CLUES.Defintion: a sign or some information that helps you to find the answer to a problem, question, or mystery

COMPASSIONATE.Defintion: showing compassion (a strong feeling of sympathy and sadness for the suffering or bad luck of others and a wish to help them)

CONSISTED.Defintion: to be comprised of, made up of

DEPORT.Defintion: to force someone to leave a country, especially someone who has no legal right to be there or who has broken the law

DESERTED.Defintion: If a place is deserted, there are no people in it

ECLIPSED.Defintion: become more successful or important than something else

EMBANKMENT.Defintion: an artificial slope made of earth and/or stones

EQUIVALENT.Defintion: having the same amount, value, purpose, qualities, etc.

EXTRADITION.Defintion: the act of making someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal

FANTASTIC.Defintion: normally this means 'very good', but it can also be used to mean very unusual, strange, or unexpected

FELLOW.Defintion: used of people or a person with whom you share something, esp. the same kind of job, interest, or experience

FINGERPRINTS.Defintion: the pattern of curved lines on the end of a finger or thumb that is different in every person, or a mark left by this pattern

FLED.Defintion: past simple and past participle of flee (to escape from)

GANG.Defintion: a group of criminals who work together

GET AWAY.Defintion: to succeed in doing, especially something bad

GETAWAY.Defintion: an occasion when someone leaves a place quickly, usually after committing a crime

GRABBED.Defintion: taken hold of something or someone suddenly and roughly

HARSH.Defintion: unpleasant, unkind, cruel, or more severe than is necessary

INSPIRED.Defintion: to make someone feel that they want to do something and can do it

IRON BAR.Defintion: a large piece of hard metal

MAN INSIDE.Defintion: if you are a 'person inside', you have information about something that you could only get through being involved with that organisation

MANHUNT.Defintion: an organised search for a person, especially a criminal

MISSING A TRICK.Defintion: missing out, not taking advantage of an opportunity or situation to gain some benefit for oneself

MOTLEY CREW.Defintion: a diverse and often poorly organised group

ONTO SOMETHING.Defintion: To be onto something or someone is to be aware of other information relating to the situation, esp. when someone is trying to deceive you

OVERPOWERED.Defintion: to defeat someone by having greater strength or power

PLASTIC SURGERY.Defintion: a medical operation to bring a damaged area of skin, and sometimes bone, back to its usual appearance, or to improve a person's appearance

POP CULTURE.Defintion: music, TV, cinema, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

ROBBERY.Defintion: the crime of stealing from somewhere or someone

ROMANTICISED.Defintion: to talk about something in a way that makes it sound better than it really is, or to believe that something is better than it really is

ROUTINE.Defintion: done as part of what usually happens, and not for any special reason

ROYAL MAIL.Defintion: the postal service in the UK

SERVE.Defintion: to spend a period of time in a job or activity

SERVED.Defintion: to spend a period of time in a job or activity

SEVERE.Defintion: causing very great pain, difficulty, worry, damage, etc.; very serious

THEFT.Defintion: (the act of) dishonestly taking something that belongs to someone else and keeping it

THEFTS.Defintion: (the act of) dishonestly taking something that belongs to someone else and keeping it

THREATEN.Defintion: to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them or cause problems if they do not do what you want

TIED UP.Defintion: to make a person unable to move by tying a rope or something similar around their body or part of their body

TIP-OFF.Defintion: a secret warning or piece of secret information

TIP-OFFS.Defintion: a secret warning or piece of secret information

TRACK.Defintion: the pair of long metal bars fixed on the ground at an equal distance from each other, along which trains travel

TRIED.Defintion: past of 'try' to examine a person accused of committing a crime in a law court by asking them questions and considering known facts, and then decide if they are guilty

UNDERGROUND.Defintion: below the surface of the earth; below ground, similar to 'underworld'

VICTIM.Defintion: someone or something that has been hurt, damaged, or killed or has suffered, either because of the actions of someone or something else, or because of illness or chance

VICTIMLESS.Defintion: In a victimless crime no one suffers directly, sometimes because the people affected by the crime have agreed to take part in it
